scheme_name: PMMSY: Establishment of Medium RAS / Biofloc culture system - Haryana
brief_description: The scheme provides capital assistance to fish farmers and entrepreneurs for establishing medium-scale Recirculatory Aquaculture Systems (RAS) and Biofloc systems.
detailed_description: The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Establishment of Medium RAS / Biofloc Culture System, introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide capital assistance to fish farmers and entrepreneurs for establishing medium-scale Recirculatory Aquaculture Systems (RAS) and Biofloc systems. These models promote high-density fish production in controlled environments, significantly reducing land and water usage. It is a centrally funded scheme with a 50:50 cost-sharing pattern between the Central and State Governments. - For RAS: Minimum 6 tanks of 30 m³ each (10 tons/crop)- For Biofloc: 25 tanks of 4 m diameter and 1 m height
benefits: 40% subsidy for General Category beneficiaries. 60% subsidy for SC and Women category beneficiaries.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a permanent resident of Haryana and possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP). The applicant must have access to own land or hold a registered lease for a minimum period of 10 years. The applicant must ensure that the land is free from any legal and financial encumbrances. The applicant must have access to a reliable water source such as a canal, tube well, river, or similar. The applicant must provide a valid training certificate in fisheries or aquaculture. The applicant must agree to manage and maintain the system at their own cost after setup. The applicant must submit a Detailed Project Report (DPR) or a Self-Contained Proposal (SCP). The applicant must sign an agreement with the Department of Fisheries to avail benefits under the scheme.

Fill in the required credentials and click on the ‘Login' button. Step 3: In the opened window, click on "Scheme/Services list", and a list of schemes will appear on the screen. Step 4: Now, select the scheme and click on "Apply for Service/Scheme". Step 5: Fill in all the details in the online application form and click on "Submit". documents_required: Agreement Deed with the Fisheries Department. Date of Birth Certificate (Aadhaar/Voter ID/Matriculation). Caste Certificate (from Tehsildar, if applicable). Training Certificate (in aquaculture or fisheries). Land Records (own land or registered lease deed for 10 years). Bills/Receipts/Vouchers for purchases. Photographs of Biofloc/RAS unit with beneficiary. Bank account details and PAN card. DPR/SCP as per PMMSY guidelines
